text.0: telling his race aloud with cries repeated he sends his voice out as his boat a steersman.
text.1: o bird be ominous of happy fortune from no side may calamity befall thee.
text.2: let not the falcon kill thee nor the eagle let not the arrowbearing archer reach thee.
text.3: still crying in the region of the fathers speak here auspicious bearing joyful tidings.
text.4: bringing good tidings bird of happy omen call thou out loudly southward of our dwellings.
text.5: so that no thief no sinner may oppress us loud may we speak with heroes in assembly.
